intro: Leptosiphon nuttallii subsp. nuttallii, commonly known as Nuttall's bluebonnet, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as grasslands and limestone areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. It is a herbaceous perennial that blooms in late spring, contributing to the floral diversity of its native range.
